organization.role.auditor.help: View only access to all org and space info, settings, reports
organization.role.billing_manager.help: Can edit/change the billing account info, payment info
organization.role.manager.help: Can invite/manage users, select/change the plan, establish spending limits
organization.no_spaces_alert: Action Required: Before you can deploy apps within this organization, you'll need to create a space.
organization.no_spaces_need_admin_alert: Action Required: Before you can deploy apps within this organization, you'll need to ask a manager to create a space.

spaces.no_spaces: No spaces belong to this organization.
spaces.no_users: No users belong to this organization.

spaces.create_space.name: Space Name
spaces.create_space.warn_name_required: Please enter the name of the space to add.
spaces.create_space.unique_name_error: There is already a space with that name in this organization. Please choose another.
space.set_as_default.info: When using external authentication (eg. LDAP), new users logging in to the Management Console will be automatically added to a default space if it has been configured by the admin.
space.set_as_default.confirm: Are you sure you want to set the %{space} space as the default space?

space.add_user.name: Username
space.remove_user.confirm: Are you sure you want to remove this user?
space.delete_space.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this space? All applications, service instances and metadata associated with this space will be permanently deleted. This cannot be undone.
space.role.auditor.help: Auditors have view only access to all space information, settings, reports, logs
space.role.developer.help: Developers can create, delete, manage applications and services, full access to all usage reports and logs
space.role.manager.help: Managers can invite/manage users, enable features for a given space

domains.create_domain.public_domain: This domain will be a shared domain that all organizations can use.

routes.unmap.confirm: Are you sure you want to unmap the "%{host}" route? The application will no longer be reachable via this route.
applications.sso.title: Single sign-on
application.restart_required_message: This application has pending changes that will not be applied until it has been restarted.
application.confirm_action: Are you sure you want to %{action} this application?
application.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this application? All metadata and service instance bindings will be permanently deleted. This cannot be undone.
application.delete_services: Would you like to delete the following service instances that are bound to this application as well?
application.polling_failed_error: We're currently having difficulty retrieving data for this application. The information below may be out of date. When connectivity has been restored, this app's information will update and this message will disappear.
application.sso.disable_prompt.body: Are you sure you want to disable single sign-on for %{app_name}?
application.logs.info: This is a real-time stream of your applications logs, starting with a snapshot of the most recent log lines. During periods of high log activity some lines may not be displayed.
application.logs.historic_logs: For historic logs please use log drains or view your application log files in the file browser.
application.about.sso.enabled.title: Application single sign-on is enabled
application.about.sso.disabled.title: Application single sign-on is disabled
application.no_service_instances: No service instances have been bound to this application.
application.routes_none: No routes belong to this application.
application.services_none: No services belong to this application.
application.env_vars_none: No environment variables have been set for this app.
application.instances.no_instances_files: Files can not be viewed when there are no running instances.
application.settings.sso.tooltip: When selected, access to the application will require logging in to %{product_name}
services.name: Name
service_instances.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this service instance? This cannot be undone.
store.deploy_disabled: There are no available spaces in any of your organizations. Deployment via the app store has been disabled.
store.deploy.warn_name_required: Please enter a name for this application.
store.deploy.warn_name_invalid: The application name must only contain letters, numbers, dashes (-) or underscores (_).
cluster.node.disabled_controls_help: Note: The primary and controller roles can only be modified via the CLI. The base role can not be removed. Changing the load_balancer role requires extra steps. Please see the %{product_name} documentation for details.
usage.total_memory.desc: The total memory advertised by all DEAs, including DEAs that are configured to over-commit memory. If this is higher than total physical memory it is possible to run out of memory during periods of high application load.
usage.physical_memory.desc: The total physical memory available to DEAs for running applications.
usage.available_memory.desc: The amount of reported memory that has not been allocated to applications.
usage.provisioned_as_quota.desc: The total amount of memory assigned to organizations via their Quotas. If this is higher than total physical memory it is possible to run out of memory should enough organizations attempt to consume their quotas.
usage.allocated_to_apps.desc: The amount of reported memory that has been allocated to applications.
usage.used_by_apps.desc: The amount of physical memory currently in use by running applications.
usage.of_available_assigned_as_quota: of total reported memory has been assigned as quota
usage.of_available_allocated_to_apps: of total reported memory has been allocated to applications
usage.of_available_in_use_by_apps: of total reported memory is in use by applications
usage.of_physical_assigned_as_quota: of total physical memory has been assigned as quota
usage.of_physical_allocated_to_apps: of total physical memory has been allocated to applications
usage.of_physical_in_use_by_apps: of total physical memory is in use by applications
dashboard.incoming_requests_description: Real-time requests being successfully routed to applications.
dashboard.routing_errors_description: Real-time routing errors occurring. Errors typically indicate problems with applications hosted within the cluster.
dashboard.load_description: The distribution of incoming requests to each router in the cluster. A heavily biased distribution may indicate problems with load balancers fronting the routers.
dashboard.historical_requests_descriptio: Total requests routed to applications for the lifetime of the cluster.
setup.organization.placeholder: Name of the initial organization to group people in
setup.organization.help: Users are grouped into Organizations, which share quotas. %{product_name} needs at least one Organization to start with. Admins can add more later.
setup.space.placeholder: Name of the initial space to group applications in
setup.space.help: Organizations are sub-divided into Spaces, which will contain users, apps, and service instances. Every Organization needs at least one Space for deploying applications.
setup.agree_terms: Yes, I agree to the %{product} Terms of Service.
setup.email_format: Your email address must be in the format of name@domain.com
setup.agree_required: You must agree to the Terms of Service to set up the first user.
settings.role_count: Role enabled on %{smart_count} node |||| Role enabled on %{smart_count} nodes
settings.restart_role_after_save: For your changes to take effect, you must run kato restart %{role} --node <node_ip> against each node with the %{role} role.
settings.restart_process_after_save: For your changes to take effect, you must run kato process restart %{process} --node <node_ip> against each node running a %{process} process. You can find a list of these nodes by running kato process list %{process} --cluster
settings.maintenance_mode.help: Shuts down API requests but continues to serve web requests, useful when performing system operations such as importing and exporting data for upgrades. When the primary node enters maintenance mode, the Management Console becomes "read only" with the exception of this toggle (to bring it back online).
settings.maintenance_mode.export_in_prog: A %{product} export is in progress. You can not disable maintenance mode until it is complete.
settings.logging_level.help: Changes the verbosity of %{product} logs from 'debug2' (most verbose) through 'off' (silent).
settings.support_email.help: The email address displayed to end users when errors are encountered. Use an address which is monitored by %{product} administrators.
settings.app_store_urls.name: name
settings.allowed_repos.help: Debian package repositories allowed in application containers. End users can install additional packages (e.g. with apt-get or aptitude) only from these repositories.
settings.console.load_defaults.confirm: Are you sure you want to load default console settings? This will overwrite all customizations to the console.
settings.console.welcome.description: Modify the HTML below to change the content of the welcome page. The HTML will be run through the EJS templating engine and has access to all product settings (e.g. settings.product_name and settings.company_name).
settings.console.support.description: Modify the HTML below to change the content of the support page. The HTML will be run through the EJS templating engine and has access to all product settings (e.g. settings.product_name and settings.company_name) as well as the configured support_email.
settings.console.eula.description: Define a custom EULA in HTML to replace the default.
settings.console.style.description: Add custom CSS below to change the look and feel of the console. This CSS will be loaded last and is able to override any existing styling.
settings.console.product.description: Change the properties below to apply custom branding to %{product}.
settings.console.product.disable_pingbac: The Console will periodically send non-identifying pingbacks (%{product} version number and UUID) to ActiveState servers to help us improve the web console experience.
settings.console.theme.description: Change the default theme to apply custom branding to %{product}, or use the stylesheet settings page to completely change the look and feel of the console.
settings.config_settings_info: This is a generic interface for configuring %{product_name} which has the same functionality as the Kato Config CLI.
settings.user.enable_sudo.help: Toggles whether new accounts have 'sudo' (root) privileges within application containers. Though applications containers (LXC) are highly secure, there are potential vulnerabilities that could be exposed with sudo enabled. This should only be enabled for trusted end users.
settings.user.memory_allotted.help: The amount of memory in a default user's quota.
settings.user.services_allotted.help: The number of services a default user can request.
settings.user.applications_allotted.help: The number of applications a default user can push.
The number of URLs a default end user can use.
settings.application.allow_nonlocal_urls: Toggles whether end users can map external URLs (i.e. not on the %{product} system's domain) to their applications.
settings.dea.memory_max_percent.help: The percentage of physical memory each DEA node can use for hosted applications. The 80% default setting leaves enough memory for the OS and DEA processes on a node with 4GB of RAM.  This can be increased on nodes with more memory available (e.g. to 90% on a node with 8GB of RAM). Do not exceed 100% unless the system correctly supports swap space and has it enabled. Restart all DEA roles/nodes to apply the change.
settings.dea.max_staging_duration.help: The maximum time allowed for application staging.
settings.dea.zone.name: DEA zone
settings.stager.max_staging_duration.hel: The maximum time allowed for application staging.
settings.harbor.port_range_minimum.help: Sets the minimum for the exposed port range (default: 35000).
settings.harbor.port_range_maximum.help: Sets the maximum for the exposed port range (default: 40000).
settings.quotas.edit_quota.title: Edit Quota Definition
settings.db.capacity.help: Maximum number of service slots to allocate.
settings.db.max_db_size.help: Maximum size on disk for database services.
settings.db.max_memory.help: Maximum amount of physical memory to allocate the service.
settings.memcached.memcached_memory.help: Maximum amount of physical memory to allocate for memcached instances.
settings.file_system.max_fs_size.help: Maximum size on disk for filesystem services.
stream.create_discussion.subject: Discussion subject...
stream.create_discussion.subject_prompt: Please enter a subject for the discussion.
stream.no_matching_events: No events match the search criteria.
stream.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this?
support.community_forums_description: Community forums can be found on the ActiveState Community Site.
support.have_feedback_description: You can send us an email anytime.
support.chat_with_us_description: Join our #stackato IRC channel on Freenode and chat with one of our friendly support staff between 9:00am and 5:00pm PT.
support.speak_to_an_expert: Need to Speak to an Expert?
support.speak_to_an_expert_description: You can contact customer support anytime.
support.need_stackato_enterprise_descrip: Technical resources including training materials, whitepapers, screencasts, technical webinars, and technical blog posts, plus information on available services are available at http://www.activestate.com/stackato.
Attaching this report to your support request will help the team assist you in diagnosing problems with your set-up.
Note: Reporting is only available for the local machine via the console. To report on your entire cluster, please use kato report --all from the CLI.
support.stackato_export.stackato_export_: Export all data on this %{product} node for later restore. This may take a long time and the resulting file can be up to several gigabytes in size.
Note: Export is only available for the local machine via the console. To export your entire cluster, please use kato data export --cluster from the CLI.
support.stackato_export.maintenance_mode: This feature is only available when %{product} is in Maintenance Mode. This can be changed on the settings page.
support.stackato_export.export_in_progre: An export is currently in progress. This can take several minutes. A download link will appear here when the export is complete.
